snippet: In the newly publicized 2014 ruling, the judges cut the sentence of Mario Tolosa, a sports club vice president, from six years to 38 months.
abstract: Two judges in Argentina defend their choice to reduce sentence of child molester Mario Tolosa, arguing that crimes were less severe because victim, 6-year-old boy, had been previously abused and had shown signs of homosexuality and 'transvestite conduct'.
lead_paragraph: In the newly publicized 2014 ruling, the judges cut the sentence of Mario Tolosa, a sports club vice president, from six years to 38 months.

headline.main: Argentina: Judges Defend Sentence Reduction to Abuser of 6-Year-Old
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Argentina: Judges Defend Reduction of Sentence to Abuser of 6-Year-Old
